properties.address: Cornerstone @ St Peters Church, Church Street, Burnham, Burnham, Buckinghamshire SL1 7HX
properties.description: Every Wednesday, Cornerstone at St Peter's Church, Burnham is a social, warm and comforting place which is open to all. We offer hot beverages and light refreshments - (current favourites are toasted fruit loaf, and crumpets!) An assortment of biscuits, cakes and other goodies are often available. Friendly conversation, quiet chats, lively laughter, and community spirit are frequently to be found too - it's a busy, happy and active place to be. There is a selection of books and jigsaws and knitting wool currently available. Wednesday Welcome is our midweek opportunity to catch up with friends and make new ones as we welcome many visitors to Cornerstone, from the community, and even further afield. So, if you're in the area on Wednesdays between 10am - Noon, we'd love to make you welcome and hope you'll become one of our Wednesday Welcome regulars.
properties.title: St Peter's Church Cornerstone - Wednesday Welcome

properties.description: Residents can access the warm space at Cranford Community College on the following days: On Mondays, residents aged 60 and over can attend a Bingo Club. This takes place from 12.30pm to 2pm at the Globe Outbuilding in Cranford Community College. On Sundays, adults can access a Creative Social Club from 11am to 1pm, hosted by Creative Spaces London. Children aged 5-11yrs can attend the multi-sports activity from 11am-1pm, and there is also the Youth Creative Drama and Filmmaking Social Action Club (11-16yrs) from 11am to 3pm. Residents can also access a free hot lunch every Sunday from 12.45pm to 1.30pm.

hours._text: Bingo Club: every Monday from 12.30pm to 2pm Creative Social Club: every Sunday from 11am to 1pm Multi-sports: every Sunday 11am to 1pm Free hot lunch: every Sunday from 12.45pm to 1.30pm Youth Creative Drama and Filmmaking Social Action Club: every Sunday 11am to 3pm. All activities will run until 17th December, and resume on 8th January 2025

properties.description: Family Hubs are a friendly and safe environment for babies, children, young people, parents and carers to access support and services they need to build thriving lives. They provide a single point of contact for families with children aged 0-19, or up to 25 years old if they have special educational needs and disabilities (SEND). Family Hubs deliver a range of joined-up services, focusing particularly on parenting support, infant feeding support, early language support and perinatal mental health support.
